Sakurajima¶

class Sakurajima.api.Sakurajima(username=None, userId=None, authToken=None, proxies=None, endpoint='https://aniwatch.me/api/ajax/APIHandle')¶

Sakurajima at its core, is a wrapper around the aniwatch.me API. However, it does include some additional functionality, namely the ability to download episodes of your favorite anime in your prefered quality.

Sakurajima requires you to have an aniwatch account. It requires you to provide your username, your user ID and your auth token. For instructions on how to get those, checkout this wiki.

get_airing_anime(randomize=False)¶

Gets currently airing anime arranged according to weekdays.

Parameters

randomize (bool, optional) – [description], defaults to False

Returns

A dictionary with weekdays as keys and corresponding list of Anime objects as values.

Return type

dict

get_anime(anime_id: int)¶

Gets an anime by its ID.

Parameters

anime_id (int) – ID of the anime you want to get.

Returns

An Anime object that has all the relevant details regarding a single anime like title, description, score, number of episodes etc.

Return type

Anime

get_anime_chronicle(anime_id: int, page=1)¶

Gets the user’s anime specific chronicle.

Parameters

  • anime_id (int) – The ID of the anime whose chronicle you want.

  • page (int, optional) – The page number of the chronicle that you want, defaults to 1

Returns

A list of ChronicleEntry objects.

Return type

list[ChronicleEntry]

Gets the highest rated animes on “aniwatch.me”.

Parameters

page (int, optional) – Page number of the popularity chart that you want, defaults to 1

Returns

A list of Anime objetcs.

Return type

list[Anime]

get_episode(episode_id, lang='en-US')¶

Gets an AniWatchEpisode by its episode ID.

Parameters

  • episode_id (int) – The episode ID of the episode you want to get.

  • lang (str, optional) – Language of the episode you want to get, defaults to “en-US” (English Subbed)

Returns

An AniWatchEpisode object which has data like streams and lamguages.

Return type

AniWatchEpisode

get_episodes(anime_id: int)¶

Gets an EpisodeList object which contains all the available episodes of a given anime.

Parameters

anime_id (int) – The ID of the anime whose episodes you want.

Returns

An EpisodeList object. An EpisodeList is very similar to a normal list, you can access item on a specific index the same way you would do for a normal list. Check out the EpisodeList documentation for further details.

Return type

EpisodeList

get_latest_anime()¶

Gets the latest animes on “aniwatch.me”

Returns

A list of Anime objects.

Return type

list[Anime]

get_latest_releases()¶

Gets the latest anime releases. This includes currently airing animes.

Returns

List of Anime objects.

list[Anime]

get_latest_uploads()¶

Gets latest uploads on “aniwatch.me”. This includes animes that are not airing currently.

Returns

A list of Anime objects.

Return type

list[Anime]

get_media(anime_id: int)¶

Gets an anime’s media.

Parameters

anime_id (int) – The ID of the anime whose media you want.

Returns

A Media object. A Media object has properties like opennings, endings, OSTs etc that each contain a list of MediaEntry objects representing the respective media.

Return type

Media

get_notifications()¶

Gets the user’s unread notifications.

Returns

A list of Notification objects. A Notificaton object contains data like date, notification ID and the content etc.

Return type

list[Notification]

get_stats()¶

Gets the aniwatch.me site stats. This includes things like the total number of streams of a given quality, total users, total number of anime, movie, special entries in the aniwatch.me library.

Returns

An AniwatchStats object which wraps all the relevant statistics.

Return type

AniwatchStats

get_unread_notifications()¶

Gets a user’s unread notifications.

Returns

A list of Notification objects.

Return type

list[Notification]

get_user_anime_list()¶

Gets the user’s aniwatch.me anime list. This list includes animes that are marked by the user.

Returns

A list of UserAnimeListEntry objects. An UserAnimeListEntry objects contains information like the status, progress and total episodes etc.

Return type

list[UserAnimeListEntry]

get_user_chronicle(user_id, page=1)¶

Gets the user’s chronicle. A chronicle tracks a user’s watch history. :param user_id: The id of the target user :type user_id: int, str :param page: The page number of the chronicle that you

want, defaults to 1

Returns

A list of ChronicleEntry objects, each object wraps all the information related to an entry like episode number, date, anime ID.

Return type

list[ChronicleEntry]

get_user_media(page=1)¶

Gets the users favorite media.

Parameters

page (int, optional) – The page number of the favorites page that you want, defaults to 1

Returns

A list of UserMedia objects. A UserMedia object has data like title and media ID

Return type

list[UserMedia]

get_user_overview(user_id)¶

Gets a brief user overview which includes stats like total hours watched, total number of animes completed etc. :param user_id: The id of the target user :type user_id: int, str :return: An UserOverview object that wraps all the relevant details

regarding the given user.

Return type

UserOverview

rateAnime(anime_id: int, rating: int)¶

Sets the user’s rating for a given anime. Rate an anime zero inorder to remove the user’s rating.

Parameters

  • anime_id (int) – The ID of the anime that you want to rate.

  • rating (int) – The number of stars that you want to the rate the given anime.

search(query: str)¶

Searches the aniwatch.me library for the given anime title.

Parameters

query (str) – The title of the anime that you want to search. Aniwatch also stores synonyms, english names for animes so those can be used too.

Returns

A list of Anime objects.

Return type

[type]

classmethod using_proxy(proxy_file=None, username=None, userId=None, authToken=None, endpoint='https://aniwatch.me/api/ajax/APIHandle')¶

An alternate constructor that reads a file containing a list of proxies and chooses a random proxy to use with Sakurajima.

Parameters

  • username (str, optional) – The username of the user, defaults to None

  • userId (int, optional) – The user ID of the user, defaults to None

  • authToken (str, optional) – The auth token of the user, defaults to None

  • proxy_file ([type], optional) – The file containing the list of proxies, defaults to None

  • endpoint (str, optional) – [description], defaults to “https://aniwatch.me/api/ajax/APIHandle”

Returns

A Sakurajima object configured to use a proxy.

Return type

Sakurajima
